vmassol - (12:56): mflorea: hi marius. Could you try using categories to filter macros in the wysiwyg? It doesn't seem to work for me  
vmassol - (12:57): when I select categories they're empty  
vmassol - (12:57): (no macros listed)  
mflorea - (12:57): vmassol: with the latest 2.7 snapshot?  
vmassol - (12:57): btw someone has used "content" instead of "Content" category, we need to fix this  
vmassol - (12:57): mflorea: nope, I'm trying on xwiki.org ie 2.6  
mflorea - (12:57): let me check on xwiki.org  
mflorea - (13:01): vmassol: I'm editing platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor and the Category select box works fine. When I select "Content" from the list of categories, I have a bunch of macros, e.g. footnote, formula, etc.  
vmassol - (13:01): hmm tried onhttp://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/VincentTest  
vmassol - (13:01): (don't know if the page matters)  
vmassol - (13:01): ah i know  
vmassol - (13:01): I'm on chrome  
vmassol - (13:01): could that be it?  
vmassol - (13:01): trying FF  
mflorea - (13:01): hmm, it shouldn't matter for this, let me try with chrome

jvelo - (13:36): vmassol, WDYT using doc.creator for contributor of snippets on extensions.xwiki.org ?  
jvelo - (13:37): since there is no contributor field  
vmassol - (13:41): jvelo: ok for me  
vmassol - (13:42): jvelo: or we leave it empty  
vmassol - (13:42): jmmm  
vmassol - (13:42): hmm  
vmassol - (13:42): better leaver it empty IMO  
vmassol - (13:42): s/leaver/leave/  
vmassol - (13:43): but not sure  
jvelo - (13:43): ok but new snippets will have a contributor  
vmassol - (13:43): yes  
vmassol - (13:43): it's ok to do automatic  
vmassol - (13:43): we juste need to review them  
jvelo - (13:43): so IMO better trying to fill it  
jvelo - (13:43): yes  
vmassol - (13:43): ok let's do it  
vmassol - (13:43): :)  
jvelo - (13:44): ok  
jvelo - (14:14): vmassol, can you add a test on license to see if it's defined ?  
jvelo - (14:14): #if("$!license" != '')  
vmassol - (14:14): jvelo: I did but it's not working checking  
jvelo - (14:15): also it seems the display of the application went back to the value instead of the display value  
jvelo - (14:15): (I don  
jvelo - (14:15): 't know if it  
jvelo - (14:15): 's your changes or changes from sdumitriu)  
sdumitriu - (14:16): My change  
vmassol - (14:16): license fixed  
sdumitriu - (14:16): But $type was used both as a value and as a displayed value  
vmassol - (14:19): jvelo: bundled with is wrong it seems  
vmassol - (14:19): it has 2 XWiki Enterprise  
vmassol - (14:19): http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Extension/TagApplication  
jvelo - (14:20): vmassol, it has a XWiki Enteprise  
jvelo - (14:20): its a different product  
jvelo - (14:20): let me see where it comes from  
jvelo - (14:21): hu hu  
jvelo - (14:21): it has been there for ages on code.xwiki.org  
jvelo - (14:21): I will handle it during migration

qwebirc43367 joined #xwiki at 15:38  
qwebirc43367 - (15:38): Hello all !  
qwebirc43367 - (15:39): Can someone help me, i have rss trouble?  
qwebirc43367 - (15:39): on XE 2.5.1  
cjdelisle` - (15:39): what's the problem?  
qwebirc43367 - (15:40): I use RSS bandit, but i have trouble to retreive flux  
qwebirc43367 - (15:40): authentification problem 401  
qwebirc43367 - (15:41): i have configure in rss bandit my admin authentification of xwiki  
qwebirc43367 - (15:41): = error 401  
sburjan - (15:41): tmortagne1: ping  
qwebirc43367 - (15:42): Which authentification is require?  
sdumitriu - (15:42): qwebirc43367: I think it's a simple error which can be fixed by tweaking the URL  
sdumitriu - (15:42): Something like append &basicauth=1, checking now the correct syntax  
tmortagne1 - (15:42): sburjan: i'm in a meeting right now but ask your question anyway, will answer if i find time  
qwebirc43367 - (15:42): Global flux, i want to use: http://172.18.10.\*\*:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain  
sburjan - (15:43): tmortagne1: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3866 IMO this can be closed. Quote from you " :Since 2.4M1 it's easily configurable in xwiki.properties files:  
sburjan - (15:43): rendering.macro.code.pygments.style=friendly" WDYT ?  
qwebirc43367 - (15:44): What i must tweak?  
cjdelisle` - (15:44): http://172.18.10.\*\*:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain&basicauth=1  
sdumitriu - (15:45): Yes, that's correct, basicauth=1  
qwebirc43367 - (15:45): I try tweak the adress in many way. But nothing work  
tmortagne1 - (15:45): sburjan: you can choose a pygments theme but you can't setup it in the skin for example and i would like it to be possible at some point which is why i did not closed it  
sburjan - (15:47): tmortagne1: understood. that is a good idea. IMO I REALLY don't like the colorful style (default that we have ATM .. at least IRC logs are a little bit hard to read. if this would be used in other parts too, I would have proposed to change it  
sburjan - (15:47): \*wouldn't  
qwebirc43367 - (15:47): Global Rss need authentification by default?  
sdumitriu - (15:48): qwebirc43367: Not the RSS, the wiki requires authentication  
tmortagne1 - (15:48): sburjan: we can always choose a different pygments theme as default if you know a better one  
sburjan - (15:49): well .. we'll talk about this tomorrow .. busy day today :)  
qwebirc43367 - (15:49): <+cjdelisle`> same error with: http://172.18.10.\*\*:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain&basicauth=1  
tmortagne1 - (15:50): sburjan: yep  
cjdelisle` - (15:50): I don't know much about rss, what happens when you type that address into the web browser?  
qwebirc43367 - (15:51): <+cjdelisle`> try Open my outlook client (Outlook have same error)  
sdumitriu - (15:51): qwebirc43367: Try this instead:  
sdumitriu - (15:51): http://172.18.10.\*\*:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&basicauth=1  
qwebirc43367 - (15:52): <@sdumitriu> same problem  
qwebirc43367 - (15:52): Before V2, rss work in outlook and rss bandit  
cjdelisle` - (15:53): Try it in firefox.  
sdumitriu - (15:54): qwebirc43367: An alternative is to open up your wiki so that it doesn't require a password  
vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 15:54  
vmassol left at 15:54 (Read error: No route to host  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 16:02  
sabageru left at 16:05 (Client Quit  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 16:10  
cjdelisle` - (16:12): For attachment versioning, I'd like to save the current attachment as myImage.jpg and older attachment files will be called myImage.jpg~1.1 and myImage.jpg~1.2 and stored in the same directory. Does that make sense?  
sdumitriu - (16:12): It does  
sdumitriu - (16:12): An alternative is to use a different folder  
cjdelisle` - (16:12): Attic  
sdumitriu - (16:13): Hm, one problem is that the extension is no longer valid  
sdumitriu - (16:13): So I can't just preview/open myImage.png~1.1  
qwebirc43367 - (16:14): <@sdumitriu> What you mean open up my wiki?  
cjdelisle` - (16:14): The other options I can think of are /attachments/myImage.png/1.1 which is much worse because now the file is called 1.1/  
sdumitriu - (16:15): qwebirc43367: Can you open that URL in the browser?  
qwebirc43367 - (16:16): http://172.18.10.88:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain, nether in firefox, nether in IE just open my outlook client  
sdumitriu - (16:16): cjdelisle`:  
sdumitriu - (16:16): /attachments/myImage.png/myImage.png  
sdumitriu - (16:16): /attachments/myImage.png/myImage~1.1.png  
lucaa left at 16:16 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
sdumitriu - (16:16): /attachments/myImage.png/myImage~1.2.png  
cjdelisle` - (16:16): i like.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 16:17  
cjdelisle` - (16:17): oh. Not so sure about myImage~1.1.png  
cjdelisle` - (16:17): That seems a bit magical.  
jvdrean left at 16:18 (Quit: Leaving.  
cjdelisle` - (16:19): So the rule will be: If the file name contains a . then ~version is put before the last index of .  
cjdelisle` - (16:19): Yea I guess that works. It's a weird rule though.  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 16:20  
jvdrean left at 16:20 (Client Quit  
sdumitriu - (16:21): cjdelisle`: It will break .tar.gz  
lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 16:21  
sdumitriu - (16:21): But I guess that's OK, few people use that anyway, and I doubt they'd like to open it directly  
lucaa left at 16:21 (Client Quit  
cjdelisle` - (16:21): That's what I mean about it. It's a rule which "usually works ok".  
cjdelisle` - (16:23): What do you think about saving the attachment metadata as well? I think it would be really nice to head in the direction where the database does not need to be backed up.  
sdumitriu - (16:24): That's why I initially used filesystem+hibernate as the hint  
sdumitriu - (16:24): Pure filesystem could be done in a different component implementation  
sdumitriu - (16:24): The problem with dropping hibernate is that the metadata is not searchable anymore  
cjdelisle` - (16:25): Indeed, I have no intention of not storing the meta in the db, I'm just thinking about backing it up in the filesystem.  
sdumitriu - (16:25): Unless we use Lucene for it  
sdumitriu - (16:25): Write-only?  
cjdelisle` - (16:25): Yes for now.  
sdumitriu - (16:25): Or read-write with a searchable backup in the database?  
cjdelisle` - (16:26): My thinking is that one day in the future you will be able to switch databases just by changing the parameter and all of the data will be injected.  
cjdelisle` - (16:26): Also it would save you if the database became corrupted.  
qwebirc43367 - (16:32): <@sdumitriu> Ok i success read rss in browser. Just remove association in firefox  
sdumitriu - (16:33): qwebirc43367: Now log out from the wiki in that browser  
sdumitriu - (16:33): And try again the rss URL  
qwebirc43367 - (16:34): Ok logout, refresh rss URL -> and i continue to see rss  
qwebirc43367 - (16:34): without authentificate  
sdumitriu - (16:35): Then there's something wrong with the RSS client  
npm\_ left at 16:35 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
sdumitriu - (16:35): Can you open the RSS URL in Thunderbird?  
sdumitriu - (16:35): Or, do you have a public URL where I could test?  
qwebirc43367 - (16:36): non sry, wiki is not public  
qwebirc43367 - (16:36): but i can't deauthentificate now  
qwebirc43367 - (16:36): i have bug in main now, very strange  
qwebirc43367 - (16:36): i try something and i will Bb  
qwebirc43367 left at 16:37 (Quit: Page closed  
qwebirc74012 joined #xwiki at 16:37  
qwebirc74012 - (16:38): Ok im back, when deauthentificate, in fact i can't read Rss feed  
sdumitriu - (16:38): OK  
qwebirc74012 - (16:38): i receive xwiki login  
qwebirc74012 - (16:38): http://172.18.10.88:8080/xwiki/bin/login/XWiki/XWikiLogin?srid=gDu0rEZm&xredirect=%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fview%2FMain%2FWebRss%3Fxpage%3Dplain%26outputSyntax%3Dplain%26srid%3DgDu0rEZm  
sdumitriu - (16:39): Now, try to use the other URL, http://172.18.10.\*\*:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&basicauth=1  
qwebirc74012 - (16:40): I have an authentification popup  
sdumitriu - (16:40): K  
sdumitriu - (16:40): Enter the username/pass there  
sdumitriu - (16:40): It should work now  
qwebirc74012 - (16:40): if i put my xwiki user login, i see rss  
sdumitriu - (16:40): Great  
sdumitriu - (16:41): So, the right URL to use is this last one  
qwebirc74012 - (16:41): in browser...  
qwebirc74012 - (16:41): ok !  
sdumitriu - (16:41): And you must also use the username/password to authenticate  
sdumitriu - (16:41): If it still doesn't work, then it's a problem in RSS Bandit  
qwebirc74012 - (16:42): yes, good in rss bandit. Nice. But it seems outlook can't use authentification with rss..  
qwebirc74012 - (16:42): another problem  
qwebirc74012 - (16:42): A lots of thanks !  
qwebirc74012 - (16:43): I was lost, you save me. Continue you work is impressive, and all contributors too  
Enygma` left at 16:44 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 16:44  
cjdelisle` - (16:48): I think I'm going to scrap /attachments/myImage.png/myImage.png and only have /attachments/myImage.png/myImage~1.1.png etc. because it's much easier to implement.  
cjdelisle` - (16:48): and the db already knows what the current version is, I don't need to duplicate that.  
sdumitriu - (16:48): cjdelisle`: -1  
sdumitriu - (16:49): If you want to open the most recent version, you have to search for it  
sdumitriu - (16:50): Since the file browser could list ~1.11 between 1.1 and 1.2  
sdumitriu - (16:50): Plus, the attachment content store is different from the attachment content version store  
cjdelisle` - (16:51): So I must trust that the name with no version is the current version no matter what the attachment metadata says.  
sdumitriu - (16:51): Yes  
qwebirc74012 - (16:51): <@sdumitriu> Do you see a reason why i don't see in global RSS, all the modification of Xwiki? i'm authentificated with admin right  
cjdelisle` - (16:53): Ok. I guess that makes some sense. The versioning store will move the file and the regular store will write to the unversioned file name.  
qwebirc74012 - (16:53): Maybe waiting for a watchlistjob or cron task?  
cjdelisle` - (16:54): It's a bit more dangerous if the commit fails. One more thing to have to roll back.  
qwebirc74012 left at 17:02 (Quit: Page closed

sdumitriu - (17:46): It uses scriptaculous
